LanguageData.Muffalo.label: muffalo
LanguageData.Muffalo.description: A large herding herbivore descended from buffalo and adapted for both cold and warm environments. While enraged muffalo are deadly, tamed muffalo are quite docile and can be used as pack animals.\n\nNobody is quite sure why they're blue - it might even be some early genetic modification test that just never got changed.
LanguageData.Muffalo.tools.0.label: left hoof
LanguageData.Muffalo.tools.1.label: left hoof
LanguageData.Muffalo.tools.2.label: right hoof

LanguageData.Gazelle.label: gazelle
LanguageData.Gazelle.description: A small, extremely quick antelope known for its amazingly long leap.

LanguageData.Gazelle_Corpse.label: gazelle corpse
LanguageData.Iguana.label: iguana
LanguageData.Iguana.description: These large lizards normally feed on plant matter. However, when angered, their tough hide and sharp claws make them quite dangerous.\n\nResting iguanas hold their heads high, giving them an amusing 'proud' look. But they're not proud; they're just trying to see predators so they don't get eaten.
LanguageData.Iguana.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.Iguana.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.Iguana.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.Iguana_Leather.label: iguana leather
LanguageData.Iguana_Corpse.label: iguana corpse
LanguageData.Dromedary.label: dromedary
LanguageData.Dromedary.description: A large land mammal adapted to arid environments. Domesticated since ancient times, its wool and leather are both exceptionally good at insulating against the desert heat, and its milk is quite nourishing. It can be used as a pack animal, but its bouncing gait makes it too uncomfortable to ride for any distance.\n\nBy storing water in its large humps and reclaiming moisture from its breath as it exhales, it can go weeks without drinking.

LanguageData.Dromedary.tools.1.label: right hoof
LanguageData.Dromedary.tools.3.label: head

LanguageData.Dromedary_Corpse.label: dromedary corpse
LanguageData.Buffalo.label: buffalo
LanguageData.Buffalo.description: A buffalo is a larger variation of muffalo that has survived the harsh landscape of a rimworld. They are known for their thick, brown wool, and the male's distinguished frontal tusks. They can be somewhat aggressive if you get too close.
LanguageData.Buffalo.tools.0.label: left hoof
LanguageData.Buffalo.tools.1.label: left hoof

LanguageData.Buffalo.tools.3.label: right hoof
LanguageData.Buffalo.tools.5.label: head
LanguageData.Buffalo_Leather.label: buffalo leather
LanguageData.Buffalo_Corpse.label: buffalo corpse
LanguageData.Sheep.label: Sheep
LanguageData.Sheep.description: The thick wool on these rams makes them very common sight in cold climates. They are known for their ability to climb nearly vertical, sheer cliff faces. They have no fear of falling.
LanguageData.Sheep.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.Sheep_Leather.label: Sheep leather
LanguageData.Sheep_Corpse.label: Sheep corpse
